parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Allows for filtering the collection of resources.
The expression specified is evaluated for each resource in the collection, and only items where the expression evaluates to true are included in the response.

parameters.name: $continuationtoken
parameters.description: The continuation token to use for getting the next set of resources.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: The list of resource properties to use for sorting the requested resources.

parameters.name: $sortorder
parameters.description: The sort order of the returned resources. Not used, specify asc or desc after each property name in the OrderBy parameter.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description:
The maximum number of items in the resource collection to be included in the result.
If not specified, all items are returned.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Whether to include a count of the matching resources along with the resources returned in the response.

artifactId.description: The identifier of an Artifact. Format of ArtifactId - {Origin}/{Container}/{Path}.

origin.description: The origin of the Artifact creation request. Available origins are 'ExperimentRun', 'LocalUpload', 'WebUpload', 'Dataset' and 'Unknown'.

container.description: The name of container. Artifacts can be grouped by container.

path.description: The path to the Artifact in a container.

createdTime.description: The Date and Time at which the Artifact is created. The DateTime is in UTC.

origin.description: The origin of the Artifact creation request. Available origins are 'ExperimentRun', 'LocalUpload', 'WebUpload', 'Dataset', 'ComputeRecord', 'Metric', and 'Unknown'.

container.description: The name of container. Artifacts can be grouped by container.

path.description: The path to the Artifact in a container.

ArtifactContentInformation.description: Details of an Artifact Content Information.

path.description: The path to the Artifact in a container.

BaseEvent.description: Base event is the envelope used to post event data to the Event controller

artifacts.description: Artifact details of the Artifact Ids requested.

artifactContentInformation.description: Artifact Content Information details of the Artifact Ids requested.

errors.description: Errors occurred while fetching the requested Artifact Ids.

BatchArtifactContentInformationResult.description: Results of the Batch Artifact Content Information request.

runId.description: The identifier for the run. Run IDs must be less than 256 characters and contain only alphanumeric characters with dashes and underscores.

parentRunId.description: The parent of the run if the run is hierarchical; otherwise, Null.

experimentId.description: The Id of the experiment that created this run.

status.description: The status of the run. The Status string value maps to the RunStatus Enum.

startTimeUtc.description: The start time of the run in UTC.

endTimeUtc.description: The end time of the run in UTC.

isVirtual.description: A virtual run can set an active child run that will override the virtual run status and properties

activeChildRunId.description: The RunId of the active child on a virtual run

tagsToModify.description: The KV pairs of tags to modify.

tagsToDelete.description: The list of tags to delete.

DeleteOrModifyTags.description: The Tags to modify or delete.

servicesToDelete.description: The list of Services to delete.

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

correlation.description: Dictionary containing correlation details for the error.

attributes.description: Gets the System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 collection of attributes associated with the event.

viewType.description: ViewType filters experiments by their archived state. Default is ActiveOnly

filter.description:
Allows for filtering the collection of resources.
The expression specified is evaluated for each resource in the collection, and only items where the expression evaluates to true are included in the response.
See https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/query-odata-filter-orderby-syntax for details on the expression syntax.

continuationToken.description: The continuation token to use for getting the next set of resources.

orderBy.description:
The comma separated list of resource properties to use for sorting the requested resources.
Optionally, can be followed by either 'asc' or 'desc'

top.description:
The maximum number of items in the resource collection to be included in the result.
If not specified, all items are returned.

ExperimentQueryParams.description: Extends Query Params DTO for ViewType

name.description: Name identifying this Metric within the Data Container

columns.description:
Schema shared by all values under this Metric
Columns.Keys define the column names which are required for each MetricValue
Columns.Values define the type of the associated object for each column

IMetricV2.description: Sequence of one or many values sharing a common  DataContainerId, Name, and Schema. Used only for Post Metrics.

uxMetricType.description:
String value UX uses to decide how to render your metrics

code.description: The service-defined error code. Supported error codes: ServiceError, UserError, ValidationError, AzureStorageError, TransientError, RequestThrottled.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

messageFormat.description: An unformatted version of the message with no variable substitution.

messageParameters.description: Value substitutions corresponding to the contents of MessageFormat.

referenceCode.description:
This code can optionally be set by the system generating the error.
It should be used to classify the problem and identify the module and code area where the failure occured.

detailsUri.description: A URI which points to more details about the context of the error.

target.description: The target of the error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

details.description: The related errors that occurred during the request.

createdUtc.description: The time the run was created in UTC.

userId.description: The Id of the user that created the run.

token.description: A token used for authenticating a run.

tokenExpiryTimeUtc.description: The Token expiration time in UTC.

warnings.description: A list of warnings that occurred during the run.

runUuid.description: A system generated Id for the run

parentRunUuid.description: A system generated Id for the run's parent

rootRunUuid.description: A system generated Id for the root of the run's hierarchy

hasVirtualParent.description: Indicates if this is a child of a virtual run.

lastStartTimeUtc.description: The last timestamp when a run transitioned from paused to running. Initialized when StartTimeUtc is first set.

currentComputeTime.description: The cumulative time spent in an active status for an active run.

computeDuration.description: The cumulative time spent in an active status for a terminal run.

effectiveStartTimeUtc.description: A relative start time set as LastStartTimeUtc - ComputeTime for active runs. This allows sorting active runs on how long they have been active, since an actual active duration cannot be frequently updated.

lastModifiedUtc.description: The time the run was created in UTC.

duration.description: The total duration of a run.

cancelationReason.description: The cancelation Reason if the run was canceled.

runId.description: The identifier for the run. Run IDs must be less than 256 characters and contain only alphanumeric characters with dashes and underscores.

parentRunId.description: The parent of the run if the run is hierarchical; otherwise, Null.

experimentId.description: The Id of the experiment that created this run.

status.description: The status of the run. The Status string value maps to the RunStatus Enum.

startTimeUtc.description: The start time of the run in UTC.

endTimeUtc.description: The end time of the run in UTC.

isVirtual.description: A virtual run can set an active child run that will override the virtual run status and properties

activeChildRunId.description: The RunId of the active child on a virtual run

runUuid.description: A system generated Id for the run

parentRunUuid.description: A system generated Id for the run's parent

rootRunUuid.description: A system generated Id for the root of the run's hierarchy

target.description: The name of the compute target where the run is executed.

status.description: The status of the run. The Status string value maps to the RunStatus Enum.

parentRunId.description: The parent of the run if the run is hierarchical.

createdTimeUtc.description: The creation time of the run in UTC.

startTimeUtc.description: The start time of the run in UTC.

endTimeUtc.description: The end time of the run in UTC.

warnings.description: A list of warnings that occurred during the run.

tags.description: The tag dictionary for the run. Tags are mutable.

properties.description: The properties dictionary for the run. Properties are immutable.

parameters.description: The parameters dictionary for the run. Parameters are immutable.

services.description: The interactive run services for a run. Services are mutable

inputDatasets.description: A list of dataset used as input to the run.

outputDatasets.description: A list of dataset used as output to the run.

computeDuration.description: Time spent in an active state for terminal runs.

effectiveStartTimeUtc.description:
Relative start time of active runs for ordering and computing active compute duration.
Compute duration of an active run is now() - EffectiveStartTimeUtc

runNumber.description:
Relative start time of active runs for ordering and computing active compute duration.
Compute duration of an active run is now() - EffectiveStartTimeUtc

userId.description: The Id of the user that created the run.

hasVirtualParent.description: Indicates if this is a child of a virtual run.

currentComputeTime.description: The cumulative time spent in an active status for an active run.

lastStartTimeUtc.description: The last timestamp when a run transitioned from paused to running. Initialized when StartTimeUtc is first set.

lastModifiedUtc.description: The time the run was created in UTC.

duration.description: The total duration of a run.

traceId.description:
Gets the TraceId associated with this Microsoft.MachineLearning.RunHistory.Contracts.SpanContext.
TODO: In actual spec, it is ActivityTraceId type. But that causes problems in serialization/deserialization

spanId.description:
Gets the SpanId associated with this Microsoft.MachineLearning.RunHistory.Contracts.SpanContext.
TODO: In actual spec, it is ActivitySpanId type. But that causes problems in serialization/deserialization

isRemote.description:
Gets a value indicating whether this Microsoft.MachineLearning.RunHistory.Contracts.SpanContext
was propagated from a remote parent.

isValid.description: Gets a value indicating whether this Microsoft.MachineLearning.RunHistory.Contracts.SpanContext is valid.

status.description:
Gets span status.
OpenTelemetry sets it to https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet/blob/master/src/OpenTelemetry.Api/Trace/Status.cs
That status enums are not very meaningful to us, so we customize this.

parentSpanId.description:
Gets parent span id.
TODO: In actual spec, it is ActivitySpanId type. But that causes problems in serialization/deserialization

SpanDefinition_1.description:
Most of the code in this class is vendored from here.
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet/blob/master/src/OpenTelemetry/Trace/Export/SpanData.cs
SpanData on that github link is readonly, we can't set properties on it after creation. So, just vendoring the Span
contract.
TStatus is the status enum. For runs, it is RunStatus
This is the link for span spec https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/overview.md#span

userObjectId.description:
A user or service principal's object ID.
This is EUPI and may only be logged to warm path telemetry.

userPuId.description:
A user or service principal's PuID.
This is PII and should never be logged.

userIdp.description:
A user identity provider. Eg live.com
This is PII and should never be logged.

userAltSecId.description:
A user alternate sec id. This represents the user in a different identity provider system Eg.1:live.com:puid
This is PII and should never be logged.

userIss.description:
The issuer which issed the token for this user.
This is PII and should never be logged.

userTenantId.description: A user or service principal's tenant ID.

userName.description:
A user's full name or a service principal's app ID.
This is PII and should never be logged.

upn.description:
A user's Principal name (upn)
This is PII andshould never be logged

resourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupNameParameter.description: The Name of the resource group in which the workspace is located.
